docs.snippet: In a striking rupture with past practice, the United States allowed the U.N. Security Council on Friday to condemn Israeli settlements in the West Bank and east Jerusalem as a "flagrant violation" of international law. In doing so, the outgoing Ob...
docs.lead_paragraph: In a striking rupture with past practice, the United States allowed the U.N. Security Council on Friday to condemn Israeli settlements in the West Bank and east Jerusalem as a "flagrant violation" of international law. In doing so, the outgoing Obama administration brushed aside Donald Trump's demands that the U.S. exercise its veto and provided a climax to years of icy relations with Israel's leadership.

headline.main: UN Condemns Israeli Settlements as Obama Declines to Veto
headline.print_headline: UN Condemns Israeli Settlements as Obama Declines to Veto

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by political analyst David Paul Kuhn disputes notion that Donald J Trump won presidency by appealing to bigotry of voters; argues most of his supporters disapproved of him morally, yet voted for him anyway because he appeared to be only champion of economically struggling Americans.

headline.main: Sorry, Liberals. Bigotry Didn’t Elect Donald Trump.

docs.snippet: The administration’s counterterrorism doctrine aims to spread military responsibilities to regional partners rather than have the United States act alone....

docs.abstract: Obama administration says Iraqi Prime Min Haider al-Abadi will direct long-awaited campaign by Iraqi forces to retake city of Mosul from Islamic State, despite fact that about half of 5,000 American troops in country will be involved in operation; campaign will be one of toughest tests for Pres Obama's doctrine of aiding regional partners militarily, rather than casting United States as lead in such operations.

headline.main: Battle for Mosul Tests Obama Strategy to Shift Fight’s Burden From U.S.
headline.print_headline: Mosul Campaign Tests Doctrine of U.S. Support
